snippet: Republicans have long been favored to keep control of the State Senate, but recent polls have shown Democratic candidates performing well in a number of critical contests.
abstract: Fight for control of New York State Senate grows unexpectedly competitive in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, which added a large dose of uncertainty to upcoming election; Republicans have long been favored to keep control of the Senate, but recent polls show Democratic candidates closing the gap in a number of critical contests.
lead_paragraph: Republicans have long been favored to keep control of the State Senate, but recent polls have shown Democratic candidates performing well in a number of critical contests.

headline.seo: New York State Senate Races Tighter After Storm
headline.main: State Senate Races Tighter After the Storm
headline.print_headline: State Senate Races Tighter After the Storm
